name: Air Fryer Apple Bombs
author: Yoly
summary: These cinnamon-sugar-coated apple bombs made with refrigerated biscuits are a breeze to make. Kids love to help make these.
ingredients: 1 ¼ cups peeled, cored, and chopped apples
1 (16.3 ounce) package refrigerated biscuit dough (such as Pillsbury Grands!®)
directions: Line the air fryer basket with parchment paper and preheat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Mix sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl
Place apples into another bowl and top with 1 tablespoon of cinnamon-sugar mixture
Separate each biscuit into 2, for a total of 16 pieces
Roll each piece into a 5-inch circle
Place 1 tablespoon of the apples onto each round and pinch to seal
Roll into a ball and place seam side-down in the basket, making sure they are not touching
Spray with avocado oil and air fry until golden brown, 6 to 8 minutes
Turn balls over and air fry for an additional 4 to 6 minutes
Remove from air fryer, spray with avocado oil, and roll in remaining sugar-cinnamon mixture
